meanings.definition: A line on a map or chart connecting points of equal value.
meanings.sent1: The isograph on the map showed where the temperature was the same.
meanings.sent2: The isograph on the chart connected all the points with equal elevation.
meanings.sent3: The isograph on the map made it look like a colorful spider web.
meanings.sent4: The isograph on the chart was like a thread weaving through the data points.
meanings.sent5: The isograph on the map stood out with its bold, straight line.

meanings.definition: A curve on a graph representing a function with a constant value.
meanings.sent1: The isograph on the graph displayed a constant value for the function.
meanings.sent2: The isograph showed where the function remained the same on the graph.
meanings.sent3: The isograph on the graph seemed to be taking a leisurely stroll.
meanings.sent4: The isograph on the graph was like a steady heartbeat in the data.
meanings.sent5: The isograph on the graph was as clear as a bright, sunny day.
